title: Introduction to CSS
content: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to style HTML elements, control layout, colors, fonts, and more.

title: Selectors
content: CSS selectors are patterns used to select the HTML elements you want to style. They include class, id, pseudo-classes, and more.
questions: What is the difference between class selector and id selector?

title: Box Model
content: Every HTML element is a rectangular box. The box model consists of content, padding, border, and margin.
questions: How does box-sizing affect element dimensions?
